introduction: This video provides an overview of containers and their role in software development and deployment. Containers are isolated environments that allow developers to create, run, and manage applications without worrying about conflicts or compatibility issues. They are formed with overlapping layers and can be easily deployed to various cloud platforms or run on local machines. The video covers the basics of container creation, communication, and deployment using Docker and Kubernetes.
